C.J..action: Questions what happened and seeks clarification from Johnny and others at the scene.

C.J..action: Defends Johnny by saying 'He didn't hit him. Johnny wouldn't do that.' despite others' concerns.

C.J..action: Appears nervous and uncertain when pressed about the incident, looking to others for confirmation.

C.J..action: Responds to Madeline's concern with 'Yeah, yeah, I'm good.' snapping to life.

C.J..action: Refuses to call the cops despite being urged by others after an incident involving Johnny hitting someone with a 2x4.

C.J..action: Rapidly taps his foot and stares at the floor during a meeting with Madeline and the realtor.

C.J..action: Calls the Ford dealership to get a reference on Johnny Cross.

C.J..action: Realizes he dialed a wrong number and quickly corrects it by redialing the correct number for the Ford dealership.

C.J..assessment: By minimizing his friends' concerns and defending a person accused of harmful actions, C.J. appears dismissive and somewhat naive, which undermines trustworthiness and tolerance.

C.J..action: Quickly dials 911 upon seeing Troy injured and bleeding.
C.J..assessment: C.J. responds promptly and responsibly to an emergency, showing concern and care for others' well-being.

C.J..action: Pauses before deciding not to fire Johnny after the accident.
C.J..assessment: C.J. shows tolerance and a willingness to withhold harsh judgment, indicating a degree of understanding and fairness.

C.J..action: Asks repeatedly what happened, showing concern and desire to understand the situation.
C.J..assessment: This demonstrates C.J.'s sincere interest in the truth and the welfare of those involved.

C.J..action: Signs paperwork promptly when Peggy points at it.
C.J..assessment: C.J. shows cooperation and willingness to comply with office procedures, indicating a basic level of trust and friendliness in a professional context.

C.J..action: Calls Johnny's references to verify his employment history.
C.J..assessment: By taking the time to check references, C.J. demonstrates responsibility and a sincere effort to make a trustworthy hiring decision, reflecting conscientiousness and respect for others.

C.J..action: Asks about customer complaints or injuries during the reference call.
C.J..assessment: This shows C.J.'s thoroughness and concern for the well-being of customers and the company, which can be seen as a sign of sincerity and care, though it is a professional obligation rather than a warm personal gesture.

C.J..action: Negotiates the commission rate with Manas, ultimately agreeing on a fair compromise after some back-and-forth.
C.J..assessment: C.J. demonstrates a willingness to engage respectfully and find a middle ground, showing fairness and a cooperative attitude.

C.J..action: Invites Manas to go inside to complete the paperwork after the deal is made.
C.J..assessment: This action shows professionalism and a friendly, inclusive approach to concluding the transaction.

C.J..action: Negotiates commission with Manas, holding firm on a reasonable rate and eventually settling on 7%, after some back and forth.
C.J..assessment: This shows C.J.'s ability to negotiate effectively, balancing firmness with flexibility to reach a deal that benefits him while satisfying the client.

C.J..action: Quickly assesses the value of the boat and the commission worth his time.
C.J..assessment: Demonstrates good judgment and business acumen by recognizing when a low commission is not worth his effort and standing his ground.

C.J..action: Invites Manas to go inside to complete paperwork immediately after the deal.
C.J..assessment: Shows professionalism and efficiency by moving promptly to formalize the agreement, indicating confidence and organizational skills.

C.J..action: Approaches Victor to clarify the unauthorized sale of the boat and offers to resolve the issue by involving the coast guard.
C.J..assessment: C.J. demonstrates a sense of responsibility and honesty by addressing the problem directly, though his approach is somewhat firm and businesslike rather than warm or friendly.

C.J..action: Admits to making a big mistake and sincerely apologizes to Frank and Steve, asking them to come back to work.
C.J..assessment: This shows C.J.'s willingness to take accountability and express regret, indicating sincerity and a desire to mend relationships, which are positive warmth indicators.

C.J..action: Nods and listens attentively to Frank and Steve's reasons for not returning.
C.J..assessment: C.J.'s attentive listening suggests respect and tolerance for others' decisions, reflecting a moderate level of warmth.

C.J..action: Approaches Fred, a black customer, with hand outstretched and says 'Mine!'
C.J..assessment: C.J. greets Fred in an inclusive and friendly manner, showing openness and equal treatment regardless of race.

C.J..action: Offers a young couple with two children free storage at the lot for five years.
C.J..assessment: This generous offer demonstrates kindness, goodwill, and a sincere desire to help others beyond mere business transactions.

C.J..action: Offers to take customer Dylan out on his new boat and teach him how to operate it, providing as many private lessons as needed for free.
C.J..assessment: Offering free lessons and personal guidance demonstrates generosity, friendliness, and a sincere desire to help the customer feel comfortable and supported.

C.J..action: Initiates calls to past customers to inform them about the biggest sale of all time.
C.J..assessment: Proactively reaching out to customers shows diligence and a friendly effort to maintain relationships, though it is primarily business-oriented rather than deeply personal or warm.

C.J..action: Offers to include accessories like an anchor, bumpers, and a VHF radio for free to close the deal.
C.J..assessment: This shows a willingness to be accommodating and generous to the buyer, indicating a friendly and good-natured approach.

C.J..action: Sighs and walks towards the retail space to gather the accessories after being challenged about their availability.
C.J..assessment: Although he complies, the sigh suggests some frustration or reluctance, which may indicate limited patience or tolerance in this interaction.

C.J..action: Returns with an armload of accessories and holds out his hand to seal the deal.
C.J..assessment: This action reflects sincerity and a friendly gesture to finalize the agreement, showing trustworthiness and a desire to maintain good relations.

C.J..action: Sits silently on the deck with others, looking defeated after losing the sale.
C.J..assessment: The silence and defeated demeanor may suggest a reserved or withdrawn side, possibly indicating difficulty in openly expressing warmth or friendliness in moments of disappointment.

C.J..action: Claims to have a whole case of VHF radios and GPS units inside the retail space to support the sale.
C.J..assessment: This shows an attempt to appear knowledgeable and prepared, indicating some level of confidence and sales skill, but it may be misleading or inaccurate.

C.J..action: Sighs and walks towards the retail space to gather the accessories after being challenged.
C.J..assessment: This demonstrates a reactive approach rather than proactive competence; he does not have the items immediately available, which undermines his credibility.

C.J..action: Returns with an armload of accessories and confidently asks for a deal.
C.J..assessment: Shows some ability to quickly respond to challenges and maintain composure, but the overall situation suggests he was unprepared initially.

C.J..action: Sits silently on the deck looking defeated after the sale falls through.
C.J..assessment: This non-action indicates a lack of resilience or strategic thinking to recover from a setback, reflecting poorly on his competence.
